reviewText: Oh yeah! She definitely rules. This DVD is worth the money. The main reason why is because I see Cher in a way which I never saw her before. I finally see how beautiful she really is, and how talented she is. She really loves her audience, and gives them a great amount of appreciation and attention. Talk about performance, charm, warmth and generosity.Like Cher stated in her little talk at the beginning, she put 35 years of her career into the show. And she sang so well, it was like I went back in time to when the songs were first written and performed.With 6 or 7 costume changes, and gorgeous wigs, Cher blew me, as well as the audience away with her stunning, one of a kind voice and getup. She knows how to be a lady on stage, as well as an entertainer in the funniest of ways. The woman is a remarkable comedienne as well as a remarkable Actress. I was so happy at the end of the show, when she actually sang the song "Believe", rather than Lip-Synching it, like on the VH1 Divas Live show.The costume was as futuristic as the song. I think all her costumes were designed by the ever famous Bob Mackie, who also designed Tina Turner's earlier costumes.The Bio and Photo Gallery were nice touches to the decent lengthed show, as bonuses. This DVD stands as my 5th so far, in my collection. All songs were perfect, but I think some of the guys in the audience were disappointed because Cher decided to do the slow version of "We all Sleep Alone". The version found on the "Believe" cd is better, but not the original. Either one performed live must be really great. Because I liked all the songs, I won't bother to talk about them, but srongly urge you to buy this DVD and see for yourself, how Cher can rule the dancefloor and the stage every time you put her music on.Hope my review helped you.
Title: N/A

reviewerName: Beverly J. Scott "Author and avid reader"
reviewText: Cher captivates listeners of all ages in this foot-stomping, sing-a-long extravaganza. Cher's costumes are as attention getting as each and every song she belts out. The best part of this video is that you can play it over and over, enjoying each and every song of this talented artist. Her music is timeless and listeners of all ages will find themselves entertained. I applaud Cher for her ability to stay young and vibrant year after year. God Bless you , Cher. Keep it up.Beverly J Scott author of Righteous Revenge

reviewText: I seen Cher twice live in Las Veags in 1982.It was the worst show I ever saw,and I went a second time because I got the tickets free. She was the laziest performer I ever seen in my life. She sounded great,but she only  sang a half a second between ten dress changes,and her voice was recorded  while her dancers were on stage doing all the work. It was great to see  Cher get back to buisness on this show and  give us our moneys worth. I  always loved Cher,and think her voice is one of a kind. To think she has  the number one song to close out the Century with "Beleive," what  a talent.They said when the world ends,there will still be Rats,Segals,and  Cher. This Video is fantastic,and Cher sings all her hits,like "Half  Breed,Dark Lady"and alot of her songs from the 80's. This Video is a  tresure,and a must buy for a fan of Cher's.Also,congradulations Cher on you  first grammy,I'm sure there will be many more,and I love Rosie's joke.That  Cher is so old,she calls everyone Sonny now.
summary: Cher finally giving us our money's worth

reviewText: I got the rare opportunity to see her "Believe Tour" in Minneapolis in 1999.  I sat only ten rows away from the stage.  Cher was amazing!  Though there's nothing like live experience, this DVD still features the Las Vegas concert wonderfully.  The elaborate stage settings and the numerous costumes are amazing.  Such energy gives her music and her show the extra enjoyment.  She opens the show with "I Still Haven't Found What I'm Looking For".  It lives up to the original U2 version.  From that song to the end, there's never a dull moment.  The film clippings from her past interviews, performances, music videos, movies, and the "Sonny And Cher Show" are enjoyable.  They show more of how she's evolved from "Gypsies, Tramps, And Thieves" to the Grammy-winning "Believe".  Besides her stage presence, her voice is amazing.  Such concert quality makes this DVD worth watching several times.  This is important material for any Cher fan to include in their collection.

reviewText: Cher is simply the BEST. I was lucky enough to catch her live show this past summer and she put on an OUTSTANDING show, probably one of - if not the most entertaining show I've ever seen. This DVD of Cher live in Las Vegas captures her in all her greatness.  She has never looked better! She is quite stunning and her voice is just as mesmorizing as it was 30 years ago. She goes through her hits one by one electrifying her performance. We even get to see old footage of her and Sonny and her own variety show. As an added bonus we get to see clips of her films. She transforms into several different looks through out the show looking more and more beautiful and sexy than before. She's truly a legend and an icon for all those young gals trying to make it in this business. She sings everything from "I Found Someone" to "Half Breed" to "Believe" I am hoping for the Farewell Tour to be released next so we can see "Song For the Lonely". CHER is one of kind :)
summary: Cher has still got it babe!

reviewText: Cher might not be the best singer, actress, or beauty in the world - but she is certainly one of the great entertainers of her generation (or any generation for that matter).  This concert, originally aired on HBO, is the essence of Cher and chronicles her  four-decade career. Through multiple costume changes, Cher recreates her various past incarnations -- from the long-haired Cher of the 70s to disco diva of the 80s to soft-rock balladeer of the early 90s to her lastest "comeback" as a  techno-pop wonder with "Believe."  Some may say this is a bold move (can you imagine a 50+ year old Madonna prancing around in a wedding dress singing "Like a Virgin"?) but would we expect anything different?  From her outlandish costumes to her self-mocking chats with the audience - Cher, after all these years, has perfected her act.All of her musical hits are included in this concert along with a cover versions of U2's "I Still Haven't Found What I'm Looking For" and Mark Cohn's "Walking in Memphis" (a rousing version which Cher obviously has great fondness for but did not achieve success with).  Extras on the DVD include a biography, photo gallery, costume designs, and the film-snippets that were used on the big screen at the concert (a nice addition since they are hard to see during the concert and often drowned out by the crowd's cheers).  Having seen actually seen this concert live, it is nice to have it on DVD to relive a very entertaining evening with Cher.

reviewText: I was seriously tempted to see Cher when she was touring last summer.  She is, after all, the essence of showbiz camp, and from everything I'd read, the show sounded like a genuine extravaganza.  (I'm also a fan of Cyndi  Lauper, who was Cher's opening act on this tour). So it might have been  fun. But then I saw those prices...well, forget it. When HBO announced that  they'd be broadcasting it, I thought that might be a reasonable alternative  to paying $75.00 to seeing what at best sounded like a guilty, kitschy  pleasure. (Of course, I'd miss seeing Cyndi, but how long would she have  been allowed to play anyway, 20 minutes? a half hour?)Turns out I was  right, the concert video is more than enough.  It's fun. It IS something of  an extravaganza with its Cirque du Soleil trappings (She refers to it as  "Cher du Soleil" at one point), but I'm just as glad that I  didn't shell out for the actual event.Cher, who, according to legend,  was furious with Sonny for originally dragging her to Vegas, seems  remarkably at home there.  She and her team have crafted the ultimate  garish spectacle and it's oddly appropriate that it be taped in the capital  city of garish spectacles.For what it is, it's loads of fun.  Cher is  what she is, an entertainer first and foremost.  She's not a great singer,  by any means, and she leaves the dancing up to others, BUT she's got  pizzazz and star quality (with a leavening touch of self-deprecating  humor).  This is not a bad way to spend a couple of hours, but I'm just as  glad to do so in the comfort of my own living room.
summary: Cher & Vegas -- a match made in Heaven

reviewText: OK, I finally admit it --- I've been a Cher fan ever since the days of the top-rated Sonny & Cher show, which aired on CBS in the early 1970's. Each week, I looked forward to Cher's latest Bob Mackie creations, her lushly-orchestrated musical numbers and even Sonny Bono's bad jokes. Cher has always been the first to admit that she's not the greatest singer in the world and that's probably true. But she is, without a doubt, one of the foremost entertainers in show business. This DVD of her sellout 1999 concert at the MGM Grand in Las Vegas is, in my opinion, the highlight of Cher's long, illustrious career.  I was actually surprised to find that it was so good.  Not only is Cher in the most -incredible- voice of her career at this concert, she looks better than ever and puts on a show that will leave your heart pounding with excitement. It must have cost zillions to mount this lavish production but you can clearly see and hear every penny that was spent. Even if you are not a Cher fan, you will love this video simply for it's immense production values.  It's fitting that this spectacular show was performed at the MGM, three letters which have stood for the finest in quality entertainment since 1924. "Do it big, do it right, give it class" -- this was an MGM rule in the old days and Cher's sensational show at the MGM Grand certainly lives up to that standard.  Packed with spectacle and song, this DVD is a bargain at -any- price but it's a fantastic value here at Amazon.com. So go for it. You will not be disappointed. After watching this video, you'll enthusiastically proclaim, "Wow! That's entertainment!"
Title: N/A

reviewText: It's a pity that Cher had to turn to the other "Divas" to find a suitable performance for todays advanced audience. The show is without a doubt a spectacle but that's only because she's rehashed all the elements  of past concerts from Madonna, Gloria Estefan and Janet Jackson. What we're  left with is a taste of leftovers from a woman of great potential, now if  only she'd put some of that to the test and injected a large amount of her  own imagination instead of relying on what came before. I was entertained  but sadly disappointed with the show as Cher's onstage presence is little  over an hour, the rest is spent watching her dancers (who by the way are  excellent) perform or watching old video clips of Cher from days gone by  while she's off changing costumes. 7 costume changes in a 90 minute show  does seem slightly ridiculous as she's only in some of them for one song!  Saying all that, she can sing live and is a great performer and the picture  quality and sound of the DVD are excellent.. but maybe next time she'll  take a step towards originality instead of playing safe and stealing from  the best. In the end credits it says show "conceived by  Cher"...It should read, show conceived by Madonna, Gloria Estefan and  Janet Jackson.

reviewText: I now own the VHS tape of this concert, and I had not seen the concert previously.  Cher's multi-talents, and lack of baloney, are an inspiration.  And, she's performing in this concert at age 53, which isn't old, but it isn't 22.  (Heck, how many people could withstand the rigors of this kind of show at any age?)  It must have been a blast being part of the crew on this tour to have the show brimful with good spirit.  (Believe me, it makes a difference).  Who was the caterer?I love her work as an actor, and haven't seen one movie in which she does not shine.Not much of a review.  I guess I just wanted to post a compliment.
summary: Great Cher, great musicians, great dancers, great set - FUN !

reviewText: In all her years Cher has never pulled her audio visual act together better than this. The selection of songs, supporting performers and her vital personna are all in check. Finally we have a video document of Cher  at the top of her powers getting the adulation due her. The most endearing  moments are Cher entering from above singing the u2 song "I Still  Haven't Found What I'm Looking for", and the mock romance of her 3  song gypsy trilogy(Dark Lady, Gypsies Tramps and Thieves,Half  Breed)."All or Nothing " is choreographed like a Broadway piece.  Her costumes are the usual artistic heaven(Bob Mackie).To top it off Cher  is in peak vocal form despite the demands the show places on her voice(  disco-rock music).Camera work is great showcasing the talented dancers and  her staple back-up musicians! The songs off Believe cd are all done with  force and style."Believe" winds up the show with trapeze  gymnastics and optimistic joy! "Believe"! We hope Cher continues  to reign beyond Believe!
summary: Cher Reigns in Pop Splash Production
